loss.py¶

Inverse Variance Loss (IVLoss)¶

class losses.IVLoss(avg_batch=False)¶
Description:
Inverse variance loss is defined as:
\[L(\overline{y},y,\sigma) = \frac{ \sum_{i=0}^{m} (\overline{y_i} - y_i)^2 * \sigma_i }{m} \]

Or with batch normalization:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}L(\overline{y},y,\sigma) &= \frac{ \sum_{i=0}^{m} (\overline{y_i} - y_i)^2 * \sigma_i }{m*w} \\w &= \frac{1}{\sum_{i=0}^{m} \sigma_i}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
forward(y_pred, y, lbl_std)¶
